page.title: 04INTRO. EMPLOYMENT,EDUCATION
page.content: Woods.It therefore makes owning a car essential to most residents living away from the two bus routes. Employment in the area is limited to work on the nearby farms and some seasonal work on the fruit farms.The Barracks employs about 300 civilians. Most people who live in the area either work in the Medway towns or commute to London.Up to recently a large number were employed at the BP Oil refinery mentioned earlier or at Chatham Dockyard.Both these major establishments have now closed down. Education on the Hoo Peninsula was re- organised in 1977.The Primary schools in the area are now 5-9 First Schools, one at Chattenden and one at Cliffe Woods which also has a Middle School. Chattenden children transfer to Hoo Middle School.All the Middle Schools feed the Hoo 13-18 Upper School.
